H0.text: Where in Europe is the Attila Line a major divide. Greece

H1.text: Where in Europe is the Attila Line a major divide. Bulgaria

H2.text: Where in Europe is the Attila Line a major divide. Romania

H3.text: Where in Europe is the Attila Line a major divide. Kıbrıs

A4.text: The dividing line is also referred to as the Attila Line, named after Turkey's 1974 military invasion, codenamed Operation Attila.

A5.text: The zone cuts through the centre of Nicosia, separating the city into southern and northern sections. In total, it spans an area of 346 square kilometres (134 sq mi), varying in width from less than 20 metres (66 ft) to more than 7 kilometres (4.3 mi). After the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989, Nicosia remains the last divided capital in Europe.
